com.smartsockets
Interface TipcConnClient

All Known Subinterfaces:
TipcSrv
public interface TipcConnClient

Handles client end of peer-to-peer connections.

An instance of this class is created through a factory class by the TipcSvc.createConnClient(java.lang.String) method.

A simple example: 

   // connect to a server listening on the local machine at port 5252
   TipcConnClient conn = TipcSvc.createConnClient("tcp:_node:5252");

   // create and send a message to the server
   TipcMsg msg = TipcSvc.createMsg(TipcMt.INFO);
   conn.send(msg);
   conn.flush();
The server (created with TipcSvc.createConnServer(java.lang.String)) must be running before the client is created, otherwise the client has no one to connect to, and will fail.

The implementing class for client connections uses two internal threads to send and receive messages. A reader thread constantly fills an inbound queue of messages as traffic arrives. Calling next(double) will pop the messages from the queue. A writer thread sends messages pushed onto the outbound queue by send(com.smartsockets.TipcMsg) when flush() is called.

Any TipcIOException thrown by the methods of this class should be considered fatal. The connection instance should be discarded, and a new connection made in its place. The responsibility for maintaining a connection is up to the user application.

See Also:
TipcConnServer, TipcSvc

Method Detail

destroy

public void destroy()
             throws TipcException
Destroys the connection.

Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcException

check

public boolean check(int check_mode,
                     double timeout)
              throws TipcException
Checks for traffic on the connection.

If check_mode is IO_CHECK_READ, this method will return true if there is data available to be read. If IO_CHECK_WRITE, true will be returned if data can be written to the connection without blocking.

If the TIMEOUT_READ option is 0.0, this method will block for up to timeout seconds. Otherwise, this method will return immediately.

Note: this method is also called by the next and search methods. This method is rarely used by end-user programs.

Parameters:
check_mode - either IO_CHECK_READ or IO_CHECK_WRITE, for checking the read or write sides of the connection.
timeout - the length of time to wait for traffic (in seconds). If timeout is 0.0, the connection will be polled, and no waiting will be done. If timeout is TIMEOUT_FOREVER, the connection will block until traffic is available.
Returns:
true if traffic is occurred, false if timed out.
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentExceptionException - if check_mode is invalid.
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

keepAlive

public boolean keepAlive()
                  throws TipcException
Send a keep alive message to the other end and wait synchronously for a response. The amount of time to wait is set by the KEEP_ALIVE timeout. If the keep alive timeout expires before the other end of the connection responds, this method will fail.

Returns:
true if the other end is alive, false otherwise.
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors
TipcException

flush

public void flush()
           throws TipcException
Flushes queued data to the connection. This ensures all buffered data is written immediately. The outbound queue will be flushed automatically when it reaches a set size, set by the setAutoFlushSize method, unless the auto flush size is set to NO_AUTO_FLUSH, in which case explicit calls to this method are required.

Throws:
TipcWouldBlockException - if the flush will fail.
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors
TipcException

send

public void send(TipcMsg msg)
          throws TipcException
Send a message. This method actually queues the data for later transmission. It is not actually sent until flush is called, either by the user directly, or by the auto-flush mechanism, based on the buffer size.

Parameters:
msg - the message to send.
Throws:
TipcWouldBlockException - if auto-flush is set and the socket cannot be written to.
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcException

sendRpc

public TipcMsg sendRpc(TipcMsg msg,
                       double timeout)
                throws TipcException
Send a message and synchronously wait for the result. The expected result message will have a message type with a number one greater than the sent message type. If a message with the expected type is not received before the timeout expires, this method will fail.

Parameters:
msg - the message to send
timeout - the amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the result
Returns:
the result message, or null if the timeout expires
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcNotFoundException - if the result message type doesn't exist.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

mainLoop

public boolean mainLoop(double timeout)
                 throws TipcException
Loop forever, reading and processing messages from the connection. This is a convenience method, which employs an infinite loop doing TipcConnClient.next, TipcConnClient.process, and TipcMsg.ack.

Parameters:
timeout - time to wait for traffic to arrive.
Returns:
false when timed out or when unable to make a connection
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

insert

public void insert(TipcMsg msg,
                   int position)
            throws TipcException
Insert a message into the inbound queue. For inserting messages to be processed as though they were received from the socket, or for re-inserting messages that have been removed, but cannot be processed immediately.

Parameters:
msg - the message to insert
position - where to insert it (zero-based). If the position is beyond the end of the list, the message will be appended to the end of the list.
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if position is negative.
TipcException

process

public void process(TipcMsg msg)
             throws TipcException
Process a message by calling the process callbacks for that message's type. A callback may be set up to process messages as they arrive. This method calls those callbacks.

Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the message is invalid.
TipcException

read

public boolean read(double timeout)
             throws TipcException
Read traffic. This is functionally equivalent to calling check with the IO_CHECK_READ mode. The background reader thread will fill the inbound message queue with any messages that arrive during the timeout period.

Parameters:
timeout - length of time (in seconds) to wait for traffic.
Returns:
true if any messages were read, false otherwise.
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

next

public TipcMsg next(double timeout)
             throws TipcException
Get messages from the inbound queue. If no messages are waiting in the inbound queue this method will block waiting for a message to arrive from the connection.

Parameters:
timeout - length of time (in seconds) to wait for a message to arrive.
Returns:
the message read, or null if timeout expires.
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

search

public TipcMsg search(double timeout,
                      TipcSearcher searcher,
                      java.lang.Object arg)
               throws TipcException
Find a message in the inbound queue, using a user-provided matching method. This method scans the inbound queue, calling a user-provided method that is handed each message in turn to see if it matches the desired criteria. If no appropriate messages are found in the inbound queue, this method will wait until the desired message arrives from the connection. The message, if found, will be removed from the inbound queue.

Parameters:
timeout - length of time (in seconds) to wait for new traffic to arrive
searcher - class implementing the TipcSearcher interface to match messages
arg - an arbitrary Object that is passed to the searcher along with the message
Returns:
the matching message, or null if no message is found before the timeout expires
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.
See Also:
TipcSearcher

searchType

public TipcMsg searchType(double timeout,
                          TipcMt mt)
                   throws TipcException
Find a message in the inbound queue matching a specific message type. This method scans the inbound queue, checking for messages matching the desired type. If no appropriate messages are found in the inbound queue, this method will wait until the desired message arrives from the connection. The message, if found, will be removed from the inbound queue.

Parameters:
timeout - length of time to wait for new traffic to arrive.
mt - the message type to look for.
Returns:
the matching message, or null if no message is found before the timeout expires.
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

searchType

public TipcMsg searchType(double timeout,
                          int mtNum)
                   throws TipcException
Find a message in the inbound queue matching a specific message type. This method scans the inbound queue, checking for messages matching the desired type. If no appropriate messages are found in the inbound queue, this method will wait until the desired message arrives from the connection. The message, if found, will be removed from the inbound queue.

Parameters:
timeout - length of time to wait for new traffic to arrive.
mtNum - the message type number to look for.
Returns:
the matching message, or null if no message is found before the timeout expires.
Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-level errors.
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread.
TipcException - for all other errors.

gmdResend

public void gmdResend()
               throws TipcException
Resends all spooled messages. For RTserver connections, this method will be called automatically when a connection is re-made, so there is no need to call it yourself. Caution: this method should only be used when a connection is first created. This method resends a messages with GMD, but does not explicitly flush the messages. You may need to invoke the flush method.

Throws:
TipcIOException - for lower-lever errors
TipcException

gmdMsgDelete

public void gmdMsgDelete(TipcMsg msg)
                  throws TipcException
Delete a message from the local spool.

Parameters:
msg - the message to delete.
Throws:
TipcMsgException - thrown if the message is not GMD
TipcNotFoundException - if the message is not present in the spool.
TipcException

gmdFileDelete

                   throws TipcException
Removes GMD files from disk

Throws:
TipcException - if the GMD files are already open

getDefaultGmdFailureCb

public TipcCb getDefaultGmdFailureCb()
Gets the default callback for GMD_FAILURE messages. This is useful if you wish to replace the default callback, which prints a warning message and deletes the failed message from the spool. The returned TipcCb object can be passed to the removeProcessCb method.

Returns:
the TipcCb containing the default callback
See Also:
removeProcessCb(com.smartsockets.TipcCb)

getTimeout

public double getTimeout(int timeout_type)
                  throws TipcException
Get a timeout value.

There are several timeout properties associated with a connection: TIMEOUT_READ, TIMEOUT_WRITE, TIMEOUT_KEEP_ALIVE, and TIMEOUT_DELIVERY, all of which are used to check for network failures. This method allows the values of these timeout properties to be inspected. All timeout values are in seconds.

The TIMEOUT_READ property specifies the length of time that no data is read on the connection before a keep alive message is exchanged with the remote end. If this is set to 0.0, the connection will block forever waiting for data to arrive and no keep alives will be generated.

The TIMEOUT_KEEP_ALIVE property is the length of time the client will wait for a reply to a keep alive request. If this timeout expires, the error callback will be called with a timeout error code.

The TIMEOUT_DELIVERY property is the length of time the client will wait for an ack to arrive for a message sent with GMD. If this expires, a GMD_FAILURE message will be generated and processed by the client.

The TIMEOUT_WRITE property is the length of time the client will wait on a write. This timeout is used to check for possible network failures. If a write timeout occurs, then the connection to RTserver is destroyed, and the RTclient will attempt to create a new connection to RTserver.

The TIMEOUT_CONNECT property is the length of time the client will wait to connect to the RTserver. This property only valid for JDK 1.4 and greater.

Parameters:
timeout_type - the timeout to return
Returns:
the requested timeout, as a second-based double.
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if timeout_type is not one of the allowed values.
TipcException

getUniqueSubject

public java.lang.String getUniqueSubject()
Retrieve the unique subject of the peer we are connected to. The unique subject is, as the name suggests, a name unique to a process. This method returns the unique subject for the process at the other end of the connection. The unique subject for this process is available from the "ss.unique_subject" property.

Returns:
the current unique subject for the peer process

getUser

public java.lang.String getUser()
Get user id of client process. Note: on some browser platforms, applets are forbidden to inspect the "user.name" property this method uses. Calling this method from applets on these platforms may result in a SecurityException.

Returns:
the user id.

getTrafficBytesRecv

Deprecated. This method is superceded by getTrafficBytesRecv8() as of SmartSockets 6.7.

Gets the total number of bytes received on the connection.

Note: The result is truncated to 31 bits, and may contain an incorrect sign bit on some older clients. New clients should use getTrafficBytesRecv8.

Returns:
the total number of bytes received on the connection.
See Also:
getTrafficBytesRecv8()

getTrafficBytesSent

public int getTrafficBytesSent()
Deprecated. This method is superceded by getTrafficBytesSent8() as of SmartSockets 6.7.

Gets the total number of bytes written to the write buffer on a connection. This number usually is the same as the total number of bytes actually sent on the connection, but sometimes the retrieved number is larger than the number of bytes sent when the write buffer is not frequently flushed.

Note: The result is truncated to 31 bits, and may contain an incorrect sign bit on some older clients. New clients should use getTrafficBytesSent8.

Returns:
the total number of bytes written to the write buffer on the connection.
See Also:
getTrafficBytesSent8()

Returns:
the total number of bytes written to the write buffer on the connection.
Since:
SmartSockets 6.7.0

                      throws TipcException
Set the auto flush size.

This is the number of bytes in the outbound buffer before an automatic flush occurs.

Parameters:

TipcException

addProcessCb

public TipcCb addProcessCb(TipcProcessCb l,
                           TipcMt mt,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a process callback class with default priority. The process callback is called when process is called with a message matching the provided message type. The message type parameter may be null, which means that all message types will be passed to this method. However, if you use the null form, you must cast the null to (TipcMt), or the compiler will be unable to resolve which version of this method you wish: this one, or the version that takes a subject parameter. To avoid the cast, you can use the mt number version instead, and pass a 0 as the mt number.

Parameters:
l - the class to add
mt - the message type this callback is interested in.
arg - argument to pass to the callback
Returns:
an opaque TipcCb object, used to remove the callback later
See Also:
TipcProcessCb

addEncryptCb

public TipcCb addEncryptCb(TipcEncryptCb l,
                           TipcMt mt,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a encrypt callback class with default priority. The encrypt callback is called before the message is encrypted. These callbacks are called only if the message type has key registered. The message type parameter may be null, which means that all message types will be passed to this method. But all the message types should have a key registered. However, if you use the null form, you must cast the null to (TipcMt), or the compiler will be unable to resolve which version of this method you wish: this one, or the version that takes a subject parameter. To avoid the cast, you can use the mt number version instead, and pass a 0 as the mt number.

Parameters:
l - the class to add
mt - the message type this callback is interested in.
arg - argument to pass to the callback
Returns:
an opaque TipcCb object, used to remove the callback later
See Also:
TipcEncryptCb

                           TipcMt mt,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a decrypt callback class for message type with default priority. The decrypt callbacks are called after the message has been decrypted. If the message type has a registered key then the message is first decrypted and then the decrypt callbacks are called. The message type parameter may be null, which means that all message types will be passed to this method. However, if you use the null form, you must cast the null to (TipcMt), or the compiler will be unable to resolve which version of this method you wish: this one, or the version that takes a subject parameter. Adds a read callback class for message type with default priority. The read callback is called when a message is read. It is called before the message is returned by the next method. The message type parameter may be null, which means that all message types will be passed to this method. However, if you use the null form, you must cast the null to (TipcMt), or the compiler will be unable to resolve which version of this method you wish: this one, or the version that takes a subject parameter. To avoid the cast, you can use the mt number version instead, and pass a 0 as the mt number.

Parameters:
l - the class to add
mt - the message type this callback is interested in.
arg - argument to pass to the callback
Returns:
an opaque TipcCb object, used to remove the callback later
See Also:
TipcReadCb

addReadCb

public TipcCb addReadCb(TipcReadCb l,
                        TipcMt mt,
                        short priority,
                        java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a read callback class for message type with default priority. The read callback is called when a message is read. It is called before the message is returned by the next method. The message type parameter may be null, which means that all message types will be passed to this method. However, if you use the null form, you must cast the null to (TipcMt), or the compiler will be unable to resolve which version of this method you wish: this one, or the version that takes a subject parameter. To avoid the cast, you can use the mt number version instead, and pass a 0 as the mt number.

Parameters:
l - the class to add
mt - the message type this callback is interested in.
priority - the priority of the callback
arg - argument to pass to the callback
Returns:
an opaque TipcCb object, used to remove the callback later
See Also:
TipcReadCb

addReadCb

public TipcCb addReadCb(TipcReadCb l,
                        int mtNum,
                        java.lang.Object arg)
                 throws TipcException
Adds a read callback class for a message type number, with default priority. The read callback is called when a message is read. It is called before the message is returned by the next method.

Parameters:
l - the class to add
mtNum - the number of the message type this callback is interested in. If this is 0, the process callback will be called for messages of any type.
arg - argument to pass to the callback
Returns:
an opaque TipcCb object, used to remove the callback later
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if mtNum is not a valid message type
TipcException
See Also:
TipcReadCb

addWriteCb

public TipcCb addWriteCb(TipcWriteCb l,
                         java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a write callback class with default priority. The write callback is called when a message is written. It is called when the message is actually sent, not when the send method is called.

Parameters:
l - the class to add
arg - argument to pass to the callback
Returns:
an opaque TipcCb object, used to remove the callback later
See Also:
TipcWriteCb

setOption

public TipcOption setOption(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String value)
                     throws TipcException
Convenience method to set an option by name.

Note: Typically one would use the Tut.setOption(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) equivalent method. This method is available for when an option needs to be different for each connection.

Parameters:
name - the name of the option to set
value - the value of the option
Returns:
the option
Throws:
TipcNotFoundException - if the named option doesn't exist
TipcException
Since:
SmartSockets 6.0

loadOptionsFile

public void loadOptionsFile(java.lang.String filename)
                     throws TipcException
Loads an option file from the local filesystem. Loaded options override existing options with the same key.

Note: Typically one would use the Tut.loadOptionsFile(java.lang.String) equivalent method. This method is available for when an option needs to be different for each connection.

Parameters:
filename - the filename of the option file to be loaded
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist
TipcIOException - if an error occurs when reading
TipcFileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist
TipcException
Since:
SmartSockets 6.0

loadOptionsURL

public void loadOptionsURL(java.lang.String spec)
                    throws TipcException
Loads a set of options remotely from a URL. Loaded options override existing options with the same key.

Note: Typically one would use the Tut.loadOptionsURL(java.lang.String) equivalent method. This method is available for when an option needs to be different for each connection.

Parameters:
spec - the url from which to read the options
Throws:
TipcMalformedURLException - if the string specifies an invalid URL
TipcIOException - if an error occurs when reading
TipcException
Since:
SmartSockets 6.0

loadOptionsStream

public void loadOptionsStream(java.io.InputStream in)
                       throws TipcException
Loads a set of options from an InputStream. Loaded options override existing options with the same key.

Note: Typically one would use the Tut.loadOptionsStream(java.io.InputStream) equivalent method. This method is available for when an option needs to be different for each connection.

Parameters:
in - the stream to load the options from.
Throws:
TipcIOException - if an error occurs when reading
TipcException
Since:
SmartSockets 6.0

makeSubjectAbsolute

public java.lang.String makeSubjectAbsolute(java.lang.String os)
If the subject isn't absolute (doesn't start with "/"), tack on the default subject prefix, if it exists. If the prefix isn't set to anything, it simply returns the original name untouched.

Parameters:
os - the subject to make absolute.
Returns:
the new subject.
Since:
SmartSockets 6.0

the size of the message queue in bytes

SmartSockets 6.0
